clinical_study.brief_title: A Single Case Study of Hypermetabolism
clinical_study.official_title: A Single Case Study of Hypermetabolism

brief_summary.textblock:
In the Metabolic Disorder clinic at The Hospital for Sick Children, the investigators identified a male, proband with possible Luft's disease. The investigators hypothesize that Luft's disease is caused by excess or dysregulation of brown/beige fat tissue.
To address the hypothesis, the investigators would like to assess brown fat distribution and activity in this subject.

detailed_description.textblock: The subject will undergo a fluorine-18-fluorodeoxyglucose positron emission tomography/computed tomography (18F FDG PET/CT) at the Diagnostic Imaging unit of The Hospital for Sick Children.

primary_outcome.measure: Brown/beige fat tissue distribution and activity. Measurement tool- 18F FDG PET/CT (fluorine-18-fluorodeoxyglucose positron emission tomography/computed tomography)
primary_outcome.description: Areas of 18F-FDG uptake on PET colocalizing with regions of fat will be identified on CT (-250to -10 Hounsfield Units) and quantified by Standard Uptake Value (SUV).

clinical_study.condition: Hypermetabolism Due to Defect in Mitochondria

arm_group.arm_group_label: One subject with possible Luft's disease
arm_group.description: 18F-FDG will be administered I.V., approximately 1 hour prior to PET/CT scan.

intervention.description: 18F FDG PET/CT imaging (fluorine-18-fluorodeoxyglucose positron emission tomography/computed tomography).
intervention.arm_group_label: One subject with possible Luft's disease
